property.name: hive.server2.thrift.port
property.description: Port number of HiveServer2 Thrift interface. Can be overridden by setting $HIVE_SERVER2_THRIFT_PORT. Default: 10000.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.http.port
property.description: Port number when in HTTP mode. Default: 10001.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.bind.host
property.description: Bind host on which to run the HiveServer2 Thrift interface. Can be overridden by setting $HIVE_SERVER2_THRIFT_BIND_HOST. Default: localhost.

property.name: hive.server2.transport.mode
property.description: Server transport mode. Value can be "binary" or "http". Default: binary.

property.name: hive.server2.logging.operation.enabled
property.description: When true, HiveServer2 will save operation logs and make them available for clients. Default: true.

property.name: hive.server2.logging.operation.log.location
property.description: Top level directory where operation logs are stored if logging functionality is enabled. Default: ${java.io.tmpdir}/${user.name}/operation_logs.

property.name: hive.server2.logging.operation.verbose
property.description: When true, HiveServer2 operation logs available for clients will be verbose. Replaced in Hive 1.2.0 by hive.server2.logging.operation.level. Default: false.

property.name: hive.server2.logging.operation.level
property.description:
HiveServer2 operation logging mode available to clients to be set at session level.
For this to work, hive.server2.logging.operation.enabled should be set to true. The allowed values are:
NONE: Ignore any logging. EXECUTION: Log completion of tasks. PERFORMANCE: Execution + Performance logs. VERBOSE: All logs. Default: EXECUTION.

property.name: hive.server2.enable.doAs
property.description: Setting this property to true will have HiveServer2 execute Hive operations as the user making the calls to it. Default: true.

property.name: hive.server2.webui.host
property.description: The host address the HiveServer2 Web UI will listen on. The Web UI can be used to access the HiveServer2 configuration, local logs, and metrics. It can also be used to check some information about active sessions and queries being executed. Default: 0.0.0.0

property.name: hive.server2.webui.port
property.description: The port the HiveServer2 Web UI will listen on. Set to 0 or a negative number to disable the HiveServer2 Web UI feature. Default: 10002

property.name: hive.server2.webui.max.historic.queries
property.description: The maximum number of past queries to show in HiveServer2 Web UI. Default: 25

property.name: hive.server2.webui.explain.output
property.description: The EXPLAIN EXTENDED output for the query will be shown in the WebUI, Drilldown, Query Plan tab when this configuration property is set to true. Prior to Hive 3.1.0, you can use hive.log.explain.output instead of this configuration property. Default: false

property.name: hive.server2.webui.show.graph
property.description: Set this to true to to display query plan as a graph instead of text in the WebUI. Only works with hive.server2.webui.explain.output set to true. Default: false

property.name: hive.server2.webui.max.graph.size
property.description: Max number of stages graph can display. If number of stages exceeds this, no query plan will be shown. Only works when hive.server2.webui.show.graph and hive.server2.webui.explain.output set to true. Only works with hive.server2.webui.explain.output set to true. Default: 25

property.name: hive.server2.webui.show.stats
property.description: Set this to true to to display statistics and log file for MapReduce tasks in the WebUI. Only works when hive.server2.webui.show.graph and hive.server2.webui.explain.output set to true. Default: false
